topics.body:
"@Ore-O":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53ddc4636368725497c60100#post_53ddc4636368725497c60100

"@SeraphimDawn":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53ddc5256368720a4d140000#post_53ddc5256368720a4d140000
I've been reading about Sino-roman relations.
As we all know Rome (or Daqin)and China knew of each other and tried to make contact. Evidence suggests Roman ambassadors made it to China
topics.author: 4fe16df67f123b13e400003f

topics.body:
"@Whatevs":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53ddc64a6368727f2e8e0000#post_53ddc64a6368727f2e8e0000
They've never had any direct contacts. But, Chinese goods such as porcelain have been found in Roman household ruins, and Roman glass have been found in China. The goods reached each other via, Central Asian and Middle Eastern merchants. China and Rome were like distant pen-pals.
!http://img156.imageshack.us/img156/3024/silkroadcoversmall.jpg!
topics.author: 4fde5cee945b700a970060fc

topics.body:
"@SeraphimDawn":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53ddc8556368727032c60100#post_53ddc8556368727032c60100
well according to these books sourced, Romans did reach China but kinda stopped at the doorstep.

It is wikipedia sadly (I was unaware, I should have asked for the source earlier) but it does reference books so maybe... but maybe not.
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sino-Roman_relations#Embassy_to_Augustus
topics.author: 4fe16df67f123b13e400003f

topics.body:
"@Whatevs":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53ddcb8c63687226445b0000#post_53ddcb8c63687226445b0000
I believe they've reached "Louyang, Henan":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Louyang#History.
The Chinese also allegedly "sent emissaries to the Roman Empire, which was known as "_Daqin_":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Daqin to the Chinese. But they never reached the city of Rome. They did, reach Antioch. And the citizens were described by the Chinese as Tall and Honest people.
topics.author: 4fde5cee945b700a970060fc
